com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class HVArrangement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.VisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidViewComponent
        • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.HVArrangement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, ComponentContainer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HorizontalArrangement, HorizontalScrollArrangement, VerticalArrangement, VerticalScrollArrangement

    public class HVArrangement
extends AndroidViewComponent
implements Component, ComponentContainer
    A container for components that arranges them linearly, either horizontally or vertically.
    Author:
    sharon@google.com (Sharon Perl), kkashi01@gmail.com (Hossein Amerkashi) (added Image and BackgroundColors)

                     int orientation,
                     boolean scrollable)
        Creates a new HVArrangement component.
        Parameters:
        container - container, component will be placed in
        orientation - one of ComponentConstants.LAYOUT_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL. ComponentConstants.LAYOUT_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL

      • $add

        public void $add(AndroidViewComponent component)
        Description copied from interface: ComponentContainer
        Adds a component to a container.

        After this method is finished executing, the given component's view must have LayoutParams, even if the component cannot be added to the container until later.

        Specified by:
        $add in interface ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        component - component associated with view

      • AlignHorizontal

        public int AlignHorizontal()
        Returns a number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned horizontally. The choices are: 1 = left aligned, 2 = right aligned, 3 = horizontally centered

      • AlignHorizontal

        public void AlignHorizontal(int alignment)
        Sets the horizontal alignment for contents of the arrangement
        Parameters:
        alignment -

      • AlignVertical

        public int AlignVertical()
        Returns a number that encodes how contents of the arrangement are aligned vertically. The choices are: 1 = aligned at the top, 2 = vertically centered, 3 = aligned at the bottom. Alignment has no effect if the arrangement's height is automatic.

      • AlignVertical

        public void AlignVertical(int alignment)
        Sets the vertical alignment for contents of the arrangement
        Parameters:
        alignment -

      • BackgroundColor

        public int BackgroundColor()
        Returns the component's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer.
        Returns:
        background RGB color with alpha

      • BackgroundColor

        public void BackgroundColor(int argb)
        Specifies the button's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer. If the parameter is Component.COLOR_DEFAULT, the original beveling is restored. If an Image has been set, the color change will not be visible until the Image is removed.
        Parameters:
        argb - background RGB color with alpha

      • Image

        public java.lang.String Image()
        Returns the path of the button's image.
        Returns:
        the path of the button's image

      • Image

        public void Image(java.lang.String path)
        Specifies the path of the button's image.

        See MediaUtil.determineMediaSource(com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Form, java.lang.String) for information about what a path can be.

        Parameters:
        path - the path of the button's image
